meanings.definition: The act of striking the palms of the hands together with a sharp sound as a form of applause or to keep time.
meanings.sent1: During the performance, the audience erupted in handclaps to show their appreciation.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with the rhythmic sound of handclaps as the music played.
meanings.sent3: The handclaps at the end of the play echoed through the theater, bringing smiles to the actors.
meanings.sent4: Her handclaps were like thunder, resonating through the room with energy and enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The handclaps of the crowd created a symphony of support for the talented singer.

meanings.definition: A sound made by striking the palms of the hands together.
meanings.sent1: The children's laughter mixed with the joyful handclaps of their game.
meanings.sent2: In the quiet room, the only sound was the gentle handclaps of the musician practicing.
meanings.sent3: The handclaps of the audience added a playful beat to the music performance.
meanings.sent4: The handclaps of the students filled the classroom with a sense of unity and fun.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic handclaps of the dancers added an extra layer of excitement to the show.
